extendedIngredients.name: belgian endives
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Belgian endives, leaves separated and cut diagonally into 1/2-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: Belgian endives, leaves separated and cut diagonally into 1/2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 medium head cauliflower (3/4 pound), stems discarded and florets cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch slices (3 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: 1/2 medium head cauliflower , stems discarded and florets cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch slices (3 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: napa cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small head Napa cabbage (1/2 pound), greenish outer leaves discarded and pale inner leaves cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces (5 cups loosely packed)
extendedIngredients.originalName: small head Napa cabbage , greenish outer leaves discarded and pale inner leaves cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces (5 cups loosely packed)

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small onion, finely chopped and soaked in cold water 10 minutes, then drained
extendedIngredients.originalName: onion, finely chopped and soaked in cold water 10 minutes, then drained

title: Winter White Salad
summary: Need a gluten free and vegetarian side dish? Winter White Salad could be an awesome recipe to try. One serving contains 161 calories, 4g of protein, and 11g of fat. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.18 per serving. It will be a hit at your Winter event. This recipe from Epicurious has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 20 minutes. A mixture of heavy cream, salt, pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 46%. This score is pretty good. Try White Winter Salad with Aged Parmigiano-Reggiano, Cauliflower, Fennel, And White Bean Winter Salad, and Winter White Cobbler for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Whisk together mustard, vinegar, cream, salt, and white pepper in a large bowl until blended.                                                                Blanch cauliflower in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan of boiling salted water 30 seconds, then drain and transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Drain well again and add to dressing in bowl. Add endives, cabbage, and onion, tossing to coat. Season with salt and pepper.

steps.step: Whisk together mustard, vinegar, cream, salt, and white pepper in a large bowl until blended.
Blanch cauliflower in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan of boiling salted water 30 seconds, then drain and transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking.
Drain well again and add to dressing in bowl.
Add endives, cabbage, and onion, tossing to coat. Season with salt and pepper.
